ethylacyl-CoA racemase deficiency
How many people are affected by alpha-methylacyl-CoA racemase deficiency ?,AMACR deficiency is a rare disorder. Its prevalence is unknown. At least 10 cases have been described in the medical literature.,GHR,alpha-methylacyl-CoA racemase deficiency
What are the genetic changes related to alpha-methylacyl-CoA racemase deficiency ?,"AMACR deficiency is caused by mutations in the AMACR gene. This gene provides instructions for making an enzyme called alpha-methylac
